Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class loads the modify product form.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes data of both parts and products table when the modify product form is loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - root path for the main form
      resourceBundle - resources used to localize the main menu

    • sendProduct

      public void sendProduct(Product selectedItem)
      This method sends the parts data into their respective text fields from the main menu. LOGICAL ERROR: productMod was null when used in initialize. Moved it to sendProduct method to fix.
      Parameters:
      selectedItem - The selected product passed over from the main menu

    • onMpAddB

      public void onMpAddB(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method adds a selected part from the top table to the bottom table's ObservableList and displays it.
      Parameters:
      event - The add button

    • onMpCancelB

      public void onMpCancelB(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      When called, this method takes the user back to the main menu without saving any changes made.
      Parameters:
      event - The cancel button
      Throws:
      IOException - input/output exception

    • onMpSaveB

      public void onMpSaveB(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method saves the new product and its data to an ObservableList. RUNTIME ERROR: NullPointerException, did not initialize associatedParts obsList in Products class. Added initialization to fix the problem.
      Parameters:
      event - The save button
      Throws:
      IOException - input/output exception

    • onRemoveApB2

      public void onRemoveApB2(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method removes the selected associated part from the bottom table and displays a pop-up confirmation box.
      Parameters:
      event - The remove associated part button

    • onMpPartsSearch

      public void onMpPartsSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method searches through the parts list in the top table by name and id and displays the results.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The enter key on the parts search bar
